summary.span: 表示抽象类，用于控制由 类执行的序列化。

span.span: Represents an abstract class used for controlling serialization by the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在初始化期间，.NET Framework 的 XML 序列化基础结构会动态生成并编译派生自抽象类的序列化的临时类 。During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for serialization that is derived from the abstract class. 还在 .NET Framework 中实现，以便将 和 对象序列化为 XML 文档。 is also implemented within the .NET Framework for serialization of and objects into XML documents. 不应从派生类 。You should not derive classes from . 请改为调用 方法。Instead, call the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 的受保护成员 仅供在 .NET FRAMEWORK XML 序列化基础结构内部使用的派生类使用。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. 在初始化期间，.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构会动态生成和编译派生自的序列化的临时类 。During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for serialization that is derived from . 在此过程中，.NET Framework 生成实现委托的写入方法 。During this process, the .NET Framework generates write methods that implement the delegate. 它针对通过 SOAP 编码的 XML 进行序列化的 .NET Framework 类型和 XML 数据类型之间的某些映射执行此操作，而不是根元素。It does so for certain mappings between .NET Framework types and XML data types that are serialized via SOAP-encoded XML and are not root elements. 然后，根据需要，在序列化过程中调用 write 方法。Then, as necessary, a write method is called during serialization. 不应直接创建的实例 。You should not directly create an instance of . Soap 编码在 SOAP 1.1 规范的第5节中进行了介绍。SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法从无效源写入有效的 XML。The method writes valid XML from invalid sources. 例如，类的 属性 可以包含以 XML 形式无效的空格。For example, the property of the class can contain spaces, which are invalid as XML. 方法读取编码的 XML 并将其还原为原始值。The method reads the encoded XML and restores it to the original value. 但是，的 方法 无法读取此类编码的 XML。However, the method of the cannot read such encoded XML. 在这种情况下，将 属性设置为 `false` 以禁用 XML 编码。In that case, set the property to `false` to disable the encoding of the XML.

summary.span: 初始化 委托的一个实例，以序列化 SOAP 编码的 XML 数据。

span.span: Initializes an instances of the delegate to serialize SOAP-encoded XML data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 的受保护成员 仅供在 .NET FRAMEWORK XML 序列化基础结构内部使用的派生类使用。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. 在初始化期间，.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构会动态生成和编译派生自的序列化的临时类 。During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for serialization that is derived from . 在此过程中，.NET Framework 生成实现委托的写入方法 。During this process, the .NET Framework generates write methods that implement the delegate. 它用于在 .NET Framework 类型和 XML 数据类型之间进行特定映射，这些映射使用 SOAP 编码的 XML 进行序列化，而不是根元素。It does so for certain mappings between .NET Framework types and XML data types that are serialized using SOAP-encoded XML and are not root elements. 然后，根据需要，在序列化过程中调用 write 方法。Then, as necessary, a write method is called during serialization. 抽象 方法是临时派生类创建的实例并初始化写入回调方法的位置。The abstract method is where the temporary derived class creates an instance of and initializes write callback methods. 不应直接创建的实例 。You should not directly create an instance of . Soap 编码在 SOAP 1.1 规范的第5节中进行了介绍。SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

summary.span: 写入一个在 SOAP 编码的 元素中出现的 特性。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 的受保护成员 仅供在 .NET FRAMEWORK XML 序列化基础结构内部使用的派生类使用。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. SOAP 编码允许唯一 XML 元素在 SOAP 消息内作为 `multiRef` 由特性标识的元素出现一次 `id` 。SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `multiRef` element identified by an `id` attribute. `id`可以通过属性 (中的属性多次引用该值， `href` 或 `ref` 在替代元素中) SOAP 1.2 中的属性。The `id` value can be referenced multiple times by `href` attributes (or `ref` attributes in SOAP 1.2) in substitute elements. Soap 编码在 SOAP 1.1 规范的第5节中进行了介绍。SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 的受保护成员 仅供在 .NET FRAMEWORK XML 序列化基础结构内部使用的派生类使用。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. SOAP 编码允许唯一 XML 元素在 SOAP 消息内作为 `` 由特性标识的元素出现一次 `id` 。SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `` element identified by an `id` attribute. `id`可以使用 `href` 属性 (或 `ref`) 替换元素中的 SOAP 1.2 中的特性多次引用该值。The `id` value can be referenced multiple times using `href` attributes (or `ref` attributes in SOAP 1.2) in substitute elements. Soap 编码在 SOAP 1.1 规范的第5节中进行了介绍。SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
